title: Intercalations in Ba2Sr2Ca2Cu3Oy and Sr2Ca2Cu3Oy and Their Critical Current Density Improvement
content: Among various cuprate high-Tc superconductors, Ba2Ca(n-1)CunOy (0(Ba)2(n-1)n) [1] and Sr2Ca(n-1)CunOy (0(Sr)2(n-1)n) [2-4] unique because their charge reservoir layers between the rock salt layers are missing. Into the empty charge reservoir layers, molecules/groups of H2O [5, 6] and CO2 [7] can be intercalated at near the room temperature. These intercalated phases showed superconductivity and further property improvements [5, 8] were found. Details of the results are as follows.
